intro: Fumana racemosa, commonly known as the mountain bluet, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds. Fumana racemosa is often found in alpine and subalpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
